name: Create and Send Tech News Digests with RSS, Gemini AI and Gmail

parameters.content: ### CyberSecurity
### AI

values.content:
=You are the editor-in-chief of a major technology newspaper. Every day you receive dozens of tech, AI and cybersecurity news articles, but your job is NOT to summarize everything. Your job is to decide WHAT REALLY MATTERS for a smart reader interested in technology, innovation and digital power. Think like a front-page editor of a tech newspaper. ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ EDITORIAL RULES ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ ### 1. SELECTION (most important rule) * From ALL provided articles, select at most 8‚Äì10 total news items. * Selecting fewer is perfectly acceptable. * Ignore minor updates, marketing announcements, product rumors, curiosities, lifestyle tech, speculative hype. --- ### 2. RELEVANCE CRITERIA (at least one) Select only news that have real strategic importance, such as: * Artificial Intelligence (foundation models, regulation, major deployments, scientific or industrial breakthroughs) * Big Tech companies (OpenAI, Google, Microsoft, Meta, Apple, Amazon, Nvidia, etc.) * Cybersecurity incidents (data breaches, ransomware, state-sponsored cyberwarfare, critical infrastructure attacks) * Regulation & digital policy (EU AI Act, privacy, antitrust, platform regulation) * Semiconductors, cloud, digital infrastructure, networks * National or European technological sovereignty * Major industrial or economic impacts of technology * Democracy, misinformation, surveillance, digital rights --- ### 3. DEDUPLICATION * If multiple articles refer to the same event, keep only one. * Prefer the most complete, clear and authoritative article. --- ### 4. STRUCTURE BY TOPIC Group the selected news into the following categories (use only those with at least one item): * AI & Machine Learning * Big Tech & Digital Industry * Cybersecurity & Cyberwar * Regulation & Digital Policy * Tech Economy & Markets * Infrastructure, Cloud & Chips * Digital Society & Rights Do NOT invent new categories. --- ### 5. WRITING STYLE + LINK (CRITICAL RULES) * Each news item: 1‚Äì2 sentences, journalistic and factual tone * No opinions, no commentary, no hype * Prefer context and implications over technical details MANDATORY LINK * Every news item must end with ONE source, formatted as a clickable HTML link on the name of the outlet only * DO NOT show the URL in plain text * DO NOT use markdown * DO NOT use parentheses, brackets or braces ‚úÖ ONLY ALLOWED FORMAT: Outlet Name ‚úÖ Correct example: Amazon Web Services introduced new chips and strengthened its AI services at the Re:Invent event, focusing on the integration of generative models for enterprises. Il Sole 24 Ore --- ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ INPUT DATA ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ You receive the last 24 hours of tech news as a JSON array of articles: {{ JSON.stringify($json.articles) }} Each article includes: * title * content * link * isoDate --- ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ TASK ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ 1. Read all articles in "articles". 2. Select only the most relevant tech / AI / cyber news (max 8‚Äì10). 3. Deduplicate articles covering the same event. 4. Organize the selected news into the defined categories. 5. Build a clean, readable HTML output, ensuring every news item includes its formatted source link. --- ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ OUTPUT (MANDATORY) ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ You must return ONLY a valid JSON object. No additional text, no explanations, no markdown, no code fences. Exact format: { "subject": "Tech & AI Briefing ‚Äì [Day Month Year]", "html": "

üß† Tech, AI & Cyber ‚Äì Top Stories

...

Tech briefing automatically generated on [Day Month Year].

" } If you include even a single word outside this JSON object, the response is INVALID.

parameters.content: ### Nvidia

## RSS Tech News to your inbox

This workflow automates the collection, normalization, and publication of content from a broad set of RSS feeds. The execution begins with a Schedule Trigger, which activates the entire pipeline at recurring intervals. Each feed is handled by its own individual RSS node, allowing full separation of sources and easier monitoring or troubleshooting. The collected items flow into a structured series of Merge nodes that consolidate all outputs into one unified data stream.

After aggregation, the workflow performs filtering and transformation. A dedicated filtering step removes invalid or duplicate entries, while a custom Function node standardizes fields such as title, URL, timestamp, and raw content. This ensures that data coming from heterogeneous sources is normalized before further processing. The workflow also includes an AI-powered enrichment stage‚Äîvia an OpenAI node‚Äîwhich generates summaries, tags, categories, or any other metadata needed to enhance the collected articles.

The pipeline concludes by delivering the processed content to a chosen destination (email, database, Notion, API endpoint, or social platform). The modular design allows new sources to be added effortlessly without altering the core logic, making the workflow scalable and easy to maintain.
This setup is ideal for automated newsletters, content curation, topic monitoring, or internal knowledge management systems.

Read: [Full setup Guide](https://paoloronco.it/n8n-template-rss-tech-news-to-your-inbox/)

#### Youtube Video: 
[![RSS Tech News](https://img.youtube.com/vi/Gck8nmvx1UA/0.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gck8nmvx1UA "RSS Tech News")

üìå Schedule Trigger
Starts the entire workflow automatically at defined intervals‚Äîno manual execution required.

üìå RSS Nodes (Multiple Sources)

Each node fetches the latest entries from one feed. Using isolated nodes keeps the flow stable and simplifies debugging.

üìå Merge Nodes

Combine all feed outputs into one coherent dataset, preparing the workflow for global filtering and processing.

üìå Filter

Filters out everything older than 24 hours by comparing each article‚Äôs isoDate to ‚Äúnow minus 24 hours‚Äù. Only fresh news is allowed through to keep the briefing truly daily and relevant.

üìå Gemini Node (AI Enrichment)

Generates summaries, keywords, topics, or enhanced textual representations of each article.

üìå Final Output Node (Email / Notion / API / etc.)

Sends the finished newsletter via Gmail.
Uses the subject from the Code node and the generated html as the email body, so you receive a curated Tech & AI briefing directly in your inbox with no manual work required.

üìåSort ‚Äì Articles by Date

Sorts all remaining articles by isoDate in descending order. This ensures that the most recent and time-sensitive stories are processed first and shown higher in the final briefing.

üìåSort ‚Äì Code in JavaScript

Takes all incoming RSS items and packs them into a single item with an articles array.
For each article it keeps: title, content or contentSnippet, link, isoDate

üìå Build Final Newsletter HTML (Code)

This Code node takes the JSON returned by the LLM and prepares the final email.
It removes any ```json wrappers, parses the JSON safely, and checks that subject and html exist.
Then it inserts both fields into a clean, responsive HTML email template.
The output is a single item containing the final subject and html, ready for the Gmail node.
### CyberSecurity
### AI
